USER_NAME.description: Your name, used in drafts and briefings

BRIEFING_CHANNEL.description: Channel for daily briefing delivery (slack, telegram, or whatsapp)

WRITING_VOICE.description: Description of your writing voice/tone for the Content Writer
WRITING_VOICE.default: Direct, conversational, no jargon. Writes like a smart person talking to another smart person.

PRIORITY_DOMAINS.description: Comma-separated email domains that should always be flagged as important (e.g. investor.com,bigclient.co)

chief-of-staff.description: Single point of contact. Orchestrates all delegation, tracks tasks, synthesizes progress, and accumulates long-term context about priorities and preferences.

inbox-manager.description: Monitors email on a 5-minute cycle. Categorizes, drafts routine responses, flags urgent items to Chief of Staff. Never sends without approval.

research-analyst.description: On-demand deep research. Produces structured briefs with executive summary, key findings, sources, and recommended actions.

content-writer.description: Handles all written output: blog posts, social media, email campaigns, investor updates, memos. Checks content calendar daily.

daily-briefing.description: Compiles the previous day's outputs from all agents into a single morning briefing. Pure summarization of structured inputs.

cron.prompt: Check for new emails. For each new message: categorize as urgent/needs-attention, routine/can-draft, informational/file-and-summarize, or spam/ignore. Draft responses for routine items. Flag anything urgent to the Chief of Staff immediately. Update your running inbox summary.

Heartbeat check. Review the current task board. Check status of all delegated work. Nudge any stuck items. If the Inbox Manager has flagged urgent items, review and decide: handle directly, escalate to the user, or delegate to a specialist. Synthesize any completed work that needs attention.

Daily content calendar check. Review the content calendar for items due today or overdue. For anything due, begin drafting. For anything overdue, flag to the Chief of Staff with a status update. If nothing is due, report all-clear.

Compile the morning briefing. Pull the previous 24 hours of activity from all agents: emails handled by the Inbox Manager, research completed by the Research Analyst, content produced by the Content Writer, and tasks managed by the Chief of Staff. Compile into a single structured briefing covering: what was handled, what's outstanding, what needs attention today, and a 3-line executive summary at the top. Deliver via the configured briefing channel.
